Are you a new user? Have a look at the\n: Are you a new user? Have a look at the Getting Started guide in our docs.
Otherwise, feel free to look at the\n: Otherwise, feel free to look at the changelog.
An open source voxel game engine.
May work on older versions, but not offi: May work on older versions, but not officially supported.
Play one of our many games, mod a game t:
Play one of our many games, mod a game to your liking, make your own game,
          or play on a multiplayer server.
Available for Windows, macOS, GNU/Linux,: Available for Windows, macOS, GNU/Linux, FreeBSD, OpenBSD, DragonFly BSD, and Android.
Luanti is distributed as a portable .zip: Luanti is distributed as a portable .zip archive on Windows.
Extract it to a folder you have write pe: Extract it to a folder you have write permissions, and run luanti.exe which can be found in the bin folder.
You can also get the latest development: You can also get the latest development version of Luanti from builds made by community members.
These builds are more recent than the of:
These builds are more recent than the officially released builds
          and contain new features (at the cost of stability).
<strong>Note:</strong> We advise not to: Note: We advise not to use unofficial builds commonly found on the Play Store.
They may contain excessive advertisement: They may contain excessive advertisements or spyware, or be distributed under proprietary terms.
These may be out of date at times. If th: These may be out of date at times. If they are too out of date, consider building from source.
There are many games to choose from. You: There are many games to choose from. You could survive in a harsh environment, build creatively, or fight other players. Just [download a game](https://content.luanti.org/packages/?type=game) or connect to a server.
add the PPA (as the repos are outdated): add the PPA (as the repos are outdated) for the Stable version:
With 62,000 × 62,000 × 62,000 blocks, th: With 62,000 × 62,000 × 62,000 blocks, there's no running out of space. You can mine 31,000 blocks down, or build 31,000 blocks up.
use\n <a href='https://flathu: use Flatpak or compile from source, as the repos are outdated
Play by yourself, locally with your frie: Play by yourself, locally with your friends, or online with dozens of players on a server.
Not happy with the look of the textures?: Not happy with the look of the textures? [Change them!](https://content.luanti.org/packages/?type=txp)
On FreeBSD 9.1 and newer, you can use th: On FreeBSD 9.1 and newer, you can use the official pre-built packages:
You can also compile Luanti and choose b: You can also compile Luanti and choose build options easily using the FreeBSD port dialogs.
Choose from many different fast map gene: Choose from many different fast map generators included in the engine, or install one as a mod.
macOS 11.3 or later is recommended. May: macOS 11.3 or later is recommended. May work on older versions when built from source.
If you experience <a href='https://githu: If you experience sound problems on macOS Tahoe 26, try an experimental build with OpenAL-soft.
Please report any problems you find with: Please report any problems you find with the experimental builds here.
Luanti @1 - App (Signed Apple Silicon, e: Luanti @1 - App (Signed Apple Silicon, experimental OpenAL-soft)
Use <a href='https://brew.sh/'>Homebrew<: Use Homebrew to get the stable version:
<a href='https://www.macports.org/'>MacP: MacPorts also contains a port of the outdated version:
Create your own voxel game using our [Lu: Create your own voxel game using our [Lua API](https://docs.luanti.org/for-creators/). No need to worry about tricky voxel rendering or networking; instead, write scripts to add items and control game play.
Get the latest <a href='https://github.c: Get the latest stable or development source code from GitHub.
See the <a href='https://github.com/luan: See the README for details on how to compile Luanti from source.
Looking for older versions? Check out th: Looking for older versions? Check out the list of releases on GitHub!
Use the same Lua API to make mods for an: Use the same Lua API to make mods for any Luanti-based game. Publish your mods on [ContentDB](https://content.luanti.org), and contribute to others' mods.
There are over 1100 open source mods on: There are over 1100 open source mods on [ContentDB](https://content.luanti.org/), which are ready to be used, adapted or learned from.
You can find help with any problems [fro: You can find help with any problems [from our community](/en/get-involved/).
The engine is open source and transparen: The engine is open source and transparently developed. [Submit an issue](https://github.com/luanti-org/luanti/issues) for anything you're missing, or get the source code and dig into it yourself.
Customized inventory screen from the [i3: Customized inventory screen from the [i3](https://content.luanti.org/packages/jp/i3/) mod
[Glitch](https://content.luanti.org/pack: [Glitch](https://content.luanti.org/packages/Wuzzy/glitch/), a platformer puzzle game with a story

Help translate Luanti using\n: Help translate Luanti using our web interface.
<a href='https://forum.luanti.org/viewto: Help us review and merge pull requests.
<a href='#donate'>Donate</a> money to pa: Donate money to pay for infrastructure, and support your favourite contributors.
Work on a <a href='https://docs.luanti.o: Work on a game or mod and publish it to ContentDB.
The <a href='https://rubenwardy.com/mine: The Luanti Modding Book provides an easy introduction to creating mods and games.
Report bugs and submit patches on\n: Report bugs and submit patches on GitHub or IRC.
For good first tasks, look out for the: For good first tasks, look out for the
Team up and create a new game.
Hang around on the forums, and help with: Hang around on the forums, and help with texture requests.
Luanti is developed and maintained by a: Luanti is developed and maintained by a group of volunteers called the core team, consisting of a bunch of people who are trusted to keep Luanti progressing in good condition.
The core team is formed of people who ha: The core team is formed of people who have made great contributions to Luanti. Contributions are approved if two members of the core team agree on them.
All development and decisions are made i: All development and decisions are made in public, on GitHub and Internet Relay Chat (IRC).
Meetings are occasionally held on IRC, w: Meetings are occasionally held on IRC, with plans and notes made public.
The core team is best contacted on\n: The core team is best contacted on IRC in #luanti-dev @ irc.libera.chat.
For more information, take a look at\n: For more information, take a look at all the rules regarding to development .
Luanti is distributed as an engine, comb: Luanti is distributed as an engine, combined with a couple of games. Upstream repositories can be found at https://github.com/luanti-org/.
<strong>The engine</strong> (core) is th: The engine (core) is the base for everything. C++ is used for housekeeping and performance-critical stuff, Lua for extensible things.
<strong>Games</strong> define game conte: Games define game content: nodes, entities, textures, meshes, sounds and custom behavior implemented in Lua. Games consist of mods that plug into the engine using the Modding API.
For more information, see the\n <: For more information, see the glossary or engine overview developer wiki pages.
As an open source project developed by v:
As an open source project developed by volunteers, Luanti is
        mostly iteratively developed rather than formally planned.
However,\n there are some overarc:
However,
        there are some overarching goals, both medium-term and long-term, that
        have been agreed upon by core developers:
Different things related to Luanti are m:
Different things related to Luanti are maintained by different people,
		contacted in different ways.
Here you can find where to report issues: Here you can find where to report issues, bugs and any other kinds of problems regarding to each “product”.
People are generally available on Libera: People are generally available on Libera <abbr title='Internet Relay Chat'>IRC</abbr>, Discord, the Luanti Forums, GitHub and/or via email.
Contact celeron55. His approval is neede: Contact celeron55. His approval is needed to host under luanti.org
Contact a moderator for concerns about c: Contact a moderator for concerns about content (Use
Luanti doesn't have a legal body to acce: Luanti doesn't have a legal body to accept donations, and most core developers do not wish to accept donations themselves.
The Liberapay team allows you to support:
The Liberapay team allows you to support multiple members at the same
        time.
You can tip money to celeron55.\n:
You can tip money to celeron55.
        He is the original creator of Luanti, and hosts the forums and wikis.
While he isn't involved in active develo:
While he isn't involved in active development, he plays an advisory
        role and breaks ties.
Your favourite server or content creator:
Your favourite server or content creator might accept tips too; make sure to
        check those out.
Find packages to support on ContentDB: Find packages to support on ContentDB
The Luanti Engine is [developed](/get-in: The Luanti Engine is [developed](/get-involved/) by an independent community of [volunteer developers](/credits/). It is provided for everyone to use, modify, and redistribute freely.
Access [a library of 2000+ free and open: Access [a library of 2000+ free and open source community developed mods](https://content.luanti.org/) to customize your EDU environment, and an accessible scripting system for you and your students to [create your own](https://rubenwardy.com/minetest_modding_book/)!
Luanti has low system requirements, is c: Luanti has low system requirements, is compatible with previous generations of hardware, and allows crossplay from any supported device.
Get involved with the wider Luanti commu:
Get involved with the wider Luanti community by joining one
          of the official social platforms.
There's an educator-led Discord for the:
There's an educator-led Discord for the discussion of Luanti in
          education.
Need a print version of this page? See t: Need a print version of this page? See the
Contribute back to the community by writ:
Contribute back to the community by writing about your project
      and/or making your learning resources publicly available.
Then,\n <a href='https://github.com: Then, create an issue or contact rubenwardy.
On the left, a voxel reconstruction of N: On the left, a voxel reconstruction of Notre Dame. On the right, a lecture theatre full of school pupils.
Since 2019, more than 600 primary school: Since 2019, more than 600 primary school students from 30 classes in 3 different countries have replicated heritage sites (like Notre-Dame de Paris, the medieval Louvre castle or the Besançon citadel), placed them on an interactive timeline and gave tours and presentations in the virtual world.
Video game screenshot. 7 natural stone p: Video game screenshot. 7 natural stone pillars rise from the banks of multiple rivers joining together.
A project funded by the University of Br: A project funded by the University of British Columbia around the use of Luanti as a learning tool and for the production of digital twins of natural and human built environments. It has been used to organize virtual field trips in the context of Covid 19.
Stylistic 3d voxel render of a school ca: Stylistic 3d voxel render of a school campus. Several eight story buildings surround a quad with a large screen.
Between November 2021 and June 2022, sec: Between November 2021 and June 2022, secondary school students from Aulney-sous-Bois in France have reinvented their neighborhood with Luanti. This project, coordinated by the IRI foundation and the teachers, allowed the students to explore the digital practice of cooperative and contributive construction. The projects created emphasized well-being and the neighborhood's conviviality.
Photo of two women pointing at an Augmen: Photo of two women pointing at an Augmented Reality voxel building.
The UNEJ project (*Urbanités Numériques: The UNEJ project (*Urbanités Numériques En Jeux*) is a 4 years project where teachers and students discover about urban planning while building concrete proposals for their neighborhood's development with the help of professionals from the sector. It is done in connection with the urban transformations carried out for the 2024 Olympics.
On the left, pupils playing Luanti on la: On the left, pupils playing Luanti on laptops. On the right, a voxel reconstruction of a city.
A Workshop for the city of Maubeuge in F: A Workshop for the city of Maubeuge in France where groups of young citizens between 10 and 16 years old shared ideas to improve their neighborhood. They then built them in an in-game map of their city, allowing urban planners to see what young people wanted for their local area and discuss current issues with them.
Video game screenshot of a collection of: Video game screenshot of a collection of pirates.
A 9 week project with two classes of Gra: A 9 week project with two classes of Grade 3 students. Aside from learning how to play the game together and various ICT skills (screenshots, image manipulation and importing), I wanted my students to research, plan and design their building project and reflect on the process.
The core team consists of contributors w:
The core team consists of contributors with special privileges and
					responsibilities.
Core developers decide what can be added:
Core developers decide what can be added to Luanti by voting for
					and against pull requests. They also have commit access to the Luanti
					team's repositories on GitHub.

An article explaining why you should use: An article explaining why you should use Luanti for education, and a guide in doing so.
Another article explaining why you shoul: Another article explaining why you should use Luanti for education, and a guide in doing so.
A 3-part post-mortem based on the author: A 3-part post-mortem based on the author's experience of using Minetest in a pre-school.
A trove of information, in multiple lang: A trove of information, in multiple languages, with a space dedicated to education. Looking for more contributions!
A database where modders can submit thei: A database where modders can submit their mods, games, and texture packs to make them easily accessible. Includes features such as a tag system, reviews, and more.
A dashboard to create worlds for future-: A dashboard to create worlds for future-oriented learning without hosting servers. Comes with support (in English/French/German), a wiki and workshops. It's currently free to use.
A website and mod that allows you to imp: A website and mod that allows you to import or share Luanti constructions on an online library.
To host a server by yourself: To host a server by yourself
The basics to host your multiplayer worl: The basics to host your multiplayer world locally or online.
To learn how to make mods: To learn how to make mods
Learn how to use Luanti's Lua API to cre: Learn how to use Luanti's Lua API to create mods and games.
